reviewText: Love it!

This is my new favorite cosmetic pouch for my purse. Its lightweight and extremely durable. It holds a ton of stuff and the bold print is easy to see in my purse. It has a zip top and another flat outside zippered pocket I use for flat items. I can put a full assortment of makeup and tissue and even have room leftover for a small hand lotion. I also like that it has a flat bottom so it stays put and sits upright on the counter.
I have a few LeSportSac bags for organizing my bag, travel, and small electronics! So many uses and cute designs!

I really like this little bag, I'm using it inside my handbag for makeup and the side zippered pocket is perfect for brushes. The metallic color makes it easy to see quickly in my black bag. It is sturdy and well made. The only picky thing that I'd like on this would be a fabric handle or looped strap. I may just add something to the zipper myself but that's not a big deal.

I love the color pattern, and the fabric can be easily cleaned with a wet wipe.  It seems durable and the zippers work well without snagging on the fabric.  The best feature is that this bag has a second pocket to allow for a little more organization, and is placed well enough that even if it's packed full it won't affect the amount of space that you have in the main compartment.

Great material with the cutest Snoopy zipper!  It holds A LOT and is probably the perfect size for work or travel.  I'm amazed at how much fits in it:  headphones (not earbuds), makeup, pens, sharpies, flash drive, brush, bandaids, gum, candy, and more.  One of the best choices in LeSportSac small cases!  The Snoopy material is so cute that I ended up buying another bag with the same pattern!  Snoopy lovers, buy, you'll love it!
summary: Great material with the cutest Snoopy zipper

I had a single compartment pouch I used for years. It had been washed many times, but was old. I found a LeSportsac that fit my needs (a smaller one) and I love it and got one for my daughter too. Now, this one is much bigger. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for something small. It depends what you need it for. I have to say, LeSportsac is not cheap, but they do last. Love them. I would highly recommend.

I bought this for an upcoming trip to Europe.  I wanted a way to lock our suitcases to each other in the trunk of the rental car.  Recently we were on a road trip not far from home and someone broke in to my car and ran off with our luggage.  I'm worried about this happening in Europe, particularly in Ireland where they have a reputation for auto break-ins.  My idea is to lock all the suitcases to each other.  So, if the thief gets the trunk open, he can't just grab a bag or two and run off.  This retractable cable looks like it will be perfect for that.  It's relatively small, and lighter than I expected.  It's not burglar-proof because a thief could cut the cable, or cut through the handles of the suitcases.  Theoretically, he could drag all the bags out of there attached to each other.  However, the point is just to make the job difficult enough that the thief moves on to the next target instead.  I think this will do the job nicely.

Like I said, it's lighter and smaller than expected, which is great.  And it's very easy to use.  Even setting the custom combination was easy.  I'm happy with it.

It is exactly as advertised!  A soft leather feel yet stands on its own.  I ordered beige and the color was exactly that.  This purse is more than a purse, it is a travel organizer with eye catching style from the inside out.  The straps (handles) are rolled and very comfortable on my shoulder.  There is more detail to this handbag than most purses I have owned.  There are 4 zippers: one on the outer back side approximately 6 1/2", one on the inside back wall approximately 6",  one dividing the inside center of the purse approximately 12 1/4" and the zipper that fully encloses this purse for security is approximately 17 1/2".  They all work perfectly showing no signs of stress.  There are two front wall inside open pockets that are side by side one is 4" wide and the other is 3 ".  The 4" pocket holds my Altoids mint container perfectly.  I thought this fact might be helpful in giving a visual as to its size.  The stitching of this purse is perfect.  As for organizational purposes, this is the best I have ever owned.  I would order again in a heartbeat from the Sori collection with out hesitation.  I was at my local post office when this package arrived and yes I opened it there.  There were several ladies present at this time and I wasn't even the first to hold it because of its appearance it was snatched up and examined by the others first.  With excitement  these questions followed:  where did you find this, is there other colors and do they have more?  I gave a great testimony as to shopping with Amazon and like my title says, Don't be shy when carrying this purse, it is an eye catcher!

Dickies seems to be the one brand of scrubs that I can rely on to be long enough in their "tall" line. I have tried a handful of others and they are just a tiny bit too short. These have ecellent attention to detail on pockets, seams, and so on. The only negative that bugs me is that they have only two belt loops, both at the front hips, nothing in back. That makes NO sense. Put a loop in the back & I'll give these 5 stars.
summary: Tall Scrubs that ARE truly Tall

reviewText: I've bought Dickies cargo scrubs before.  They had belt loops, one on each side and one in back, the minimum of belt loops as far as I was concerned.  These "slim fit" have only two loops, one near the front on each side, and none in back.  I think that missing loop will contribute to serious "plumber's butt", where the pants ride down quite a bit in back.

Good fit for a medium. I was a little unsure about getting scrub pants with a button but they still fit like regular scrub pants and also has a drawstring. The zipper fly is really helpful for bathroom breaks.
Fit well and are comfortable. I have washed them several times already and they maintain their fit and color
Good fit ,good quality

Overall I like these scrubs. I would like a snap closure on the thigh pocket, because it would keep my wallet and keys more secure. I also find that the fabric picks up lint. Not a big deal to me but it may bother others.

I love this dress. I'm 5'6" 175lbs, a size m/8-10 in US, so I was worried due to previous buyers complaining about sizing. I was afraid a medium would be too small on me because my arms are really muscular. IT IS PERFECT! The length, material, style, fit, and even the belt! I know some girls complained about the cheap belt, but it's perfect for the dress because it's light and it clips perfectly, cinching the waist. If you want an elegant, Audrey Hepburn classic style, this is the dress for you. I plan on wearing this with different belts, some lace tights, super high heels, with my hair up and red lipstick. I'm actually thinking about getting another color. Love it! I love it even more because it's a dress made in Korea. GET IT!!!

reviewText: This dress is okay if you have extra weight to hide and want a style that would be flattering for a person that is larger or top heavy, and can tolerate thick nylon material. The dress has a overall cute style but I personally swim in it and it is useless for me. Like many clothes you buy online, it looks much better in the picture and as many mentioned, the belt that comes with it is garbage. The dress can work for some people. I went with the dimensions provided for the size and even a small size would have been too big, let alone a medium!

PLEASE ALLEGRA consider making a TALL line. the pattern is VERY clever, the material works really well, but I will have to alter things as a busty tall 12, the amazing bell sleeves are too short, and the skirt , I could wear as a mini skirt if my legs were something I would like showing off. If you are of average height in the USA, this is probably a GREAT buy for you. as a lady of 1,74 m this is too short .
summary: I love it but it is not my size

reviewText: I absolutely adore this dress.  I was a little concerned when I opened the package and the dress looked huge but once belted it looks just like the picture (but a few inches shorter)  I ordered the medium but probably could have gotten away with a small.  I'm 5'3 120 lbs, but I'm a little broad in the shoulders so the top fit fine.  The sleeves are actually a little on the long side, which i prefer.  The belt it comes with is junk (it doesn't actually clasp and I accidentally shot it across the room, lol) but I have so many belts I wasn't really concerned.  It took almost a month for the item to arrive but I am very happy with it and will order from this company again.  I would recommend that you ignore the size listed (s, m, l, etc) and just look very carefully at the measurements that they provide instead.  The material is a textured polyester but I don't mind.  I can't wait to wear this out.

This is my new FAVORITE dress!  I ordered it on Nov. 2nd...and it wasn't supposed to get here until Friday, November 28, 2014 - Tuesday, December 16, 2014 by 8pm.  However, it came today...that's like a week and a 1/2 earlier than expected-yay!  It exceeded my expectations.  This is actually the 2nd dress I've bought off amazon...and if this didn't go well...I wasn't going to buy any more off here.  But, Allegra K has restored my faith -lol.  This dress is absolutely BREATHTAKING!  You can wear it w/ or w/o the belt...I love it more w/ the belt.  I know some ppl disliked and slammed the belt...saying it's cheap.  Once it's on...you can't tell that.  It's cute!  And...if you ever want to...you can always switch it out...and do like a red belt w/ red shoes... that's what I was going to do.  I originally bought this dress to wear to Christmas church service.  However, I am soooo in love w/ it...I'm wearing it to school tomorrow - lol...w/ hot pink tights and cute little ankle booties :)  I wanted to order another one...in a different color...but they don't have any x-smalls :(  I'm hoping there will be some x-smalls soon.  The dress looks expensive...and is super classy.  If you buy it...you won't be disappointed.  It's a KEEPER!  The dress fits true to size.  I'm almost 5'4"...108lbs...I usually wear a 0 in adults...an xsmall...or 2/3 in juniors.  The dress falls a few inches above my knees...which is what the picture shows.  If you're questioning whether or not you should do it... DO IT!  I thought about it a couple days...& then just ordered it.  I was nervous after my first dress purchase on here...but, am soooooo glad I took the chance.  This is my new favorite dress.  I can't wait for my friends and family to see it :)

reviewText: This is my son's 2nd pair of these Ray Bay Jr. eyeglasses and both were defective and did not last more than 6 months. Dealing with Luxottica Consumer Warranty and Repairs that handles Ray Ban's customer service is very difficult and extremely frustrating. I initially contacted them via email so I can include pictures(attached to this review) of the defective part along with my request for a replacement. It took a few back and forth emails before I realized it was pointless because I was only getting a computer generated generic response so I decided to call their toll free number. I provided the rep with the case / incident number as stated on the emails so she can understand what my concerns were and see the pictures for herself. I explained to her that I understood their policy for claiming warranty. However, given the fact that these were my son's prescription glasses and he had no spare to use while they conduct their warranty claim investigation that could take up to 6 weeks, I was hoping they will recognize the obvious defect of the part, simply send me the replacement and spare me the cost of sending them the glasses, take the risk of losing them in the mail or the lens sustaining damages that they stated they will not be responsible for and more importantly, my son not having the glasses he needs in order to see well! Instead, the rep reiterated the same generic response I got from the email giving me the option to either go through the entire warranty claim process or purchase the part to replace the factory defective one at a ridiculous price. I thanked the rep for her time and expressed my sentiments towards this particular Ray Ban product and their policy for warranty claims. My family and I all wear Ray Ban both as prescription glasses and sunglasses and have always been pleased with its quality with the exemption of this model. This was our very first contact with their customer service and it is unfortunate that the experience did not turn out the way I was expecting from a prestigious company such as Ray Ban whom I have been a big fan of for decades.
summary: Terrible quality, worse customer service for warranty requests

reviewText: looks very nice holds gun well and securely. lots of room for other things.
Love this bag! I get compliments at least weekly! I've been using the purse for the last several months and its holding up great!  Size is perfect for my wallet, pistol and other essential items.

Love it! It's the right size. Typically I carry a purse that would hold a large wallet in one pouch and my .38 special in the other (when not in a position to holster on my hip). I felt I had little extra room in that purse. Yet I have friends who carry suitcases but also do not carry concealed! This is that almost halfway mark. Big and deep, decent extra interior spots for Advil, sugars, bandages, etc. Nice size exterior zip areas and the holster pouch is a really good size. The .38 fits holster and all. The other side holds my speed loaders easily. I can put in the center pouch my large wallet, likely a book, couple kid diapers (if I were at that point, trying to give size ideas),  water bottle..all easy! I was also very pleased with the quality of the leather. I know some folks prefer super soft thin stuff, but this is more solid. The strap is a good length and wide so it won't bite your shoulder and stays there. I'll likely be buying the brown one too because it is a good fit. Lining is decent too...most I've seen pull out, not cool if you have a serious reason to quick draw. Not so sure about that little locking doodad. I mean..if there are children around and you need to lock it...the da** purse should be no where near them. Ideally...concealed carry means "on your body". However..there will be those times. That tiny lock is false security.
summary: Good price, good quality, good deal.

I really LOVED my purse, but I am not very happy with how unprofessional it is made for the money I paid for it. When looking on the outside of the purse where the little outside zipper is, I used that little zipper for my cell phone and change that I would get back from purchases I made. I mean it's not a big area and can't be used for much, with that being said after I had the purse for maybe 2 months it had came unsewn on one side of the inside of that pocket making everything that I put in it go inside the lining of the purse, and once again it's not a big area so I was always losing whatever I put in it. It is made into the rest of the purse lining so it's not like I could just pull that lining out and sew it , which would be great if it was made that way because I would have definitely done that. So now I have a purse that I so LOVED and paid quite a bit of money for that isn't but a few months old and looks brand new still just sitting in my closet :( I feel that as little time as I have had this it should have lasted WAY longer in wear and tear! I wish anyone who buys this good luck! I wish I could get mine replaced for free because I feel as though it happened so fast after I bought the purse that I did not get my money's worth!!! Thanks, Marty's Wife

The only downside to the purse is the flimsy holster provided for securing the pistol in the concealed pocket.

It is too flimsy for my liking and COULD allow the trigger to be pulled iif an object of sorts inside the purses main area got into the trigger guard and things moved around enough.  My wife carrys condition zero (No safety on her M&P at all) so I tested it out by placing the unloaded pistol intot he provided/Flimsy holster and into the concealed area; I manuevered my finger inside the main pocket of the purse and was able to get the trigger to pull; although it took my quite a bit of time and force to do so.  It is most likely 99.99% safe with the provided holster, but I like to be 100% safe.

Don't let the fact that an object could potentially cause a neglegent discharge due to the flimsy fabric holster discuade you from buying this purse, it is quite easy to form kydex and attach velcro and have a 100% safe holster to go with the purse; which is whatI recommend doing if you purchase one.

I HIGHLY DOUBT this would ever happen and realize it is a bit over thinking, but I replaced the flimsy fabric holster with a kydex holster that has a bit more retention and a fully shrouded trigger guard making it impossible to have an ND with a pistol in condition 0.

I still gave 5 stars though because I had intended on doing this in the first place as kydex makes for a great holster and you can custom form it to have the perfect retention ofr YOU.

It's hard to find a larger carry purse that's made of nice materials at a good price. This has the qualities and more. It's right or left hand draw which is an advantage. The leather is very high quality. It shows no wear after a couple of months of use. The leather looks brand new and the hardware has not tarnished. I like the hobo design which makes it easy to find things in the bag. You can fit a medium to compact size firearm in the concealed area. Full size Glocks or S & W's will print. The included pocket holster allows for perfect placement and anchors snugly to velcro in the concealed area. It anchors so snugly that you will probably have to use the "wrap the holster in paper" method to position the holster to your desired location. Locking zippers on both sides provide some security when you need to secure your firearm temporarily. The wide shoulder band helps with the carry weight and I like clip my keys with a carabiner to the strap to allow me to zip the purse and keep my keys accessible.
The price is very reasonable for this type of purse. It doesn't scream concealed carry purse, but it's much higher quality than most that you can find. You will not be disappointed.

Enough room for everything else, leather is nice, soft, and not stiff like other purses have been.  I only wish it came where you could wear it over your shoulder so I went and had the strap made longer and really love it now!
summary: Best Carry Purse I have found

reviewText:
Well, I bought two concealed carry purses - and I was positive I'd like the other one better. They both were delivered and, surprise, I like this one the best.

Here are the pros:

1) It is a shoulder strap - and although it is not adjustable, it is thick, sturdy and a great length for throwing it over a shoulder and going
2) It has two internal pockets - one large enough for my iPhone WITH the OtterBox case (which makes it pretty thick!). One that is a bit larger than that - perfect for keys, a medication bottle, etc. and a zipper pocket on the opposite inside wall of the main compartment.
3) It has a zipper pocket on each side of the purse - and an additional pocket that is easy to slip things in quickly.
4) The leather seems good quality, the zippers are heavy and appear to be good quality
5) The pocket for the gun is large enough to carry my S&W SP101 .357 revolver or my Taurus Millenium .45 or even my small Glock 45.
6) The gun does NOT show through as in a lot of the other concealed carry purses I've seen. Unless you know what you're looking for, you'd never guess it had a gun compartment.
7) The gun compartment zipper locks - it's not going to keep out a thief determined to take your stuff, but it would definitely stymie a curious child, which was my concern with grandchildren.

The cons (and some of these won't be cons for you!):

1) I couldn't find it in anything but black on amazon and black just is NOT my favorite color. I'd have rather had an earthy color - dark brown, olive green, etc. But, I still love the purse.
2) It comes with 2 keys when an awful lot of these purses come with 4. I tend to lose things - regularly - so 2 more keys would have been great, but obviously not a deal-breaker.
3) It is for a right-handed person. There's many CC purses that have access to the gun on both sides so it can be right- or left-handed. (and, honestly, access on both sides would be great because who knows how the purse would be sitting when you may need the gun). I do wish they'd change this purse so it had dual access.
4) The interior of the purse is undivided and, although it's not small, I'd not mind if it were a tad bigger. I can easily fit a full-sized checkbook wallet, some makeup, keys, etc., but, my purses tend to do double duty as tote bags half the time, so a little larger would be nice. Don't misunderstand, it's deep and a lot fits - I'm just being picky!

All in all, a great buy - I hope they decide to add some color choices though - I'd buy another in a heartbeat!
summary: I like it a lot more than I thought I would!

reviewText: Love it! Just what I was looking for! The quality was even better than I expected. One of the best purchases I have ever made.

I'm not big on purse carry--I am much more comfortable carrying my gun on me--but, being pregnant I couldn't figure out a better way to still carry to protect myself.  I looked all over for a cute, functional, easy to access conceal carry purse that wasn't crazy expensive. This one is PERFECT. Much better than I expected. It is genuine leather and very good quality.  It's very roomy! The main pocket is big enough to put just about anything I would want to carry. The front has two pockets--the zippered one, and then just below it opens as well so you can just slide your phone in there without having to unzip zippers.  My favorite function is the concealment compartment. I carry a .45 Springfield XDS and it fits great in there. The velcro holds the holster tight in place and the compartment would fit a much better gun...the compartment goes from one end of the purse to the other--but doesn't interfere with any of the other compartments.  It's easy to get to to draw your weapon and the zipper even locks in case you are somewhere where you need that function. The only complaint that I have is that the little fabric holster that comes with the gun and velcros into the concealment compartment isn't very functional. My gun is so heavy that even with the enclosed elastic strap it just didn't feel very secure--plus I have a grip safety and I didn't like that elastic strap pushing that down constantly. I have an inside the waistband PJ holster that  I slide into the fabric holster and then attached it to the inside of the purse. The clip on my IWB holster held it firmly to the fabric holster and it won't move or come out, even with multiple draws.  As for the quality, roominess, and functionality of this bag I absolutely love it!

I was surprised at the craftsmanship of this hat, it's made of wool and leather brim. I would recommend this hat for those looking for the authentic Civil War Kepi.

Same quality as my other kepi.  Wool is fine for reenactment use, however stitch quality was very poor for the leather brim attachment (which is more than likely leather over vinyl than full leather).  Also, it fits a little tighter than true to size.  As a 7, it was an S and fits more like a 6 7/8.  I can deal with the size issue, however, the stitch workmanship on the brim is horrible. It looks like it was done on a machine that had a tracking issue. Many holes and lose gaps between the brim and attachment to the base of the cap. See photo.

This is a reasonably accurate kepi.  It does fit as expected.  My hat size is 7 1/4.  However, the description boasts, "Genuine Leather Bill and Neckstrap", and I can tell you, it is not leather, but some sort of vinyl, or synthetic, with a fabric backing.  It is most certainly not leather.  I am sorry to say that it was because of this boast -- that genuine leather was used -- that I purchased this kepi, preferring it above others.  It is always a sad disappointment when a merchant uses deception to endorse a product.

I had some concerns when ordering this but those worries were unfounded and alleviated as soon as it arrived. This is a good quality replica of the Union kepi worn by earlier US soldiers. It is made of HEAVY wool (enough to make your head sweat in normal temperatures) with a leather brim and chin strap. The fit is accurate and comfortable. I bought this initially for nostalgic purposes but have since decided it is too nice to just admire once in a while.

I order the 7.75 and it was too large, so I ordered the 7.5 and it is too snug. What's a fellow like me to do! The stiff rawhide interior that gives shape to the strap makes it really inflexible as far as sizing goes. I have seen examples of forage caps (the taller civil war hat) which lacked the rawhide interior and it was a better, more flexible fit. The hat is well made, the materials are fairly close to authentic, but the sizing is tricky. Still, I'm keeping it. I'll find a way to soften it with steam and stretch it at some point.
summary: Inflexible sizing, but a good quality hat

reviewText: A fine, well made hat, probably as close to The Real Thing as one can find. The wool cloth does make it a winter cap for me, though. Real sweaty in warmer weather.

Cons:
- If you want insignia (Cavalry/Infantry/Artillery), you must buy separately. Costing over $30, this is really the reason that I didn't give the cap 5 stars.

reviewText: These are Beautiful hair clips, they are made strong and hold well, I have long hair and wouldn't buy anything else to clip my hair up with...Such Beautiful colors. Every where I go strangers stop and ask me, where did you get that hair clip.

The product is pretty and made decently as far as just looking at it as a piece of art! However actually using it is another matter all together! I did read the reviews and only proceeded to ordered these clips because I have extremely thick hair and a lot of it so I thought they would work in my hair, as opposed to those with less hair, but unfortunately they do not! The clips are way too heavy to set in the hair no matter where you place them. The only exception may be if one created an up-do, such as a bun and was able to wedge the clip into a position where it had a solid foundation wherein the clip went through another solid mass of hair that does not move...otherwise this baby is slipping right off your head. Since I can't wear these decorative clips on my head I did get inventive and decide to keep them as shoe clips to decorate my high heels! C'est la vie, considering how inexpensive they were, they were not worth taking the time to return them!

My regular bra size is 38-C and this size fits me perfectly.  I will say if you are a D cup it might be a little snug. My only negative comment has to do with color choice.  I wish there was a basic black.

I'd ordered several itsems from Allegra-K - some were just fine, some were, quite frankly awful but, astonishingly, this one is great! It's classy and stylish and well-made. The hemline is well-done (which is not the case with other Allerga-K items), including a nice decorative hem at the back. It's surely far from the quality of, say Talbots or Ann Taylor, but it's about 10 times cheaper, so this is to be expected. The colour is just as shown (I ordered the light beige one). Overall, I could not belive it that this blouse and the 3-4 other items I'd ordered were from the same company - this one is much better quality. The only thing I am not crazy about this blouse the sleeve length - they seem a bit short for my taste (I prefer them to the first thumb knuckle and these just reach my wrists). The blouse itself is a nice length - much below the waist, so I've no idea why the sleeves aren't longer. But, overall, I like it so much that I'm ordering it in black, as well.

So, if you're wondering whether to order this blouse, I'd highly recommend it. I would not recommend, however, ordering from Allegra-K in general (i.e. items with no reviews) as there seems to be a great variation in the quality of their products, so you really don't know what to expect.

One thing to consider if you decide to buy it: I wear the US size XS/S (158 cm/56 kg or 5'2'' /123 lb) and this blouse fits perfectly.

And one more thing: you should not expect any care tags or textile content - this is something Allegra-K never cares to add.

I have already received  many compliments on this shirt as it is unique and unlike anything you see in the stores. It looks just like the picture and it goes with anything! I noticed that a lot of other reviewers complained about the sleeves being short but I think that they don't understand that a bracelet sleeved shirt is supposed to fit that way. Bracelet sleeves are supposed to hit just above the wrists. So, the sleeves are not too short - they are bracelet sleeves.

Anyway, this product is great and the seller is great. I have purchased four Allegra K shirts and have been happy with each and every single one. For the price, you simply cannot beat it and the designs and styles are unlike anything you will find in the store. Take a chance and try a top but make sure you pay attention to their sizing notes! You may need to size up depending on the item.

I've gotten a couple items from the Allegra K line with caution. Every time I do, I keep my expectations low and am pleasantly surprised.

This dress however, I was just a tad bit disappointed with the fabric. It is a cute dress but maybe I thought polyester was going to be a thinner cotton type and not like plastic? The dress is pretty long and even though I got an XS it came down maybe just 3-4 inches above the knee. The idea of the dress is cute but I think the hem on the side of the skirt could use a little fixing. It's kind of weird. I think they do it so it gives the dress more of a shape but I personally think if they just did a straight hem instead of a hem that looks like a parenthesis it would look better. Overall, you get what you pay for and I think it's cute enough to pay $10 for it.

This is a very cute dress and it has some stretch and give which is why I marked it a bit too big. This dress is perfect if you have a larger chester and maybe some tummy issues. I felt the waist goes in exactly where I need it to to make it flattering. I only gave it 4 stars for 3 reasons. The sleeves hit my arm at a spot that is not flattering. It almost needs to be sleeveless or make a small puff sleeve. The second reason is that the little hearts aren't all hearts. Some of them are weird little shapes. The third reason is that even when washed, I still cannot get the wrinkles out of it. I don't currently own an iron but it really needs one.

I wore this out a few weeks ago and my friend really liked it.

This dress is EXACTLY like the picture. It is comfortable and sexy. The material is a silk-like material so it is pretty thin. The only thing I would complain about is the size. I got a large but it is a little more like an XL. I am 5'6 and 170 lbs and I can just slip it over my head instead of using the actual fitting zipper. Worth the buy!
It was an okay shirt, especially for the price. Shirts fits just right for my size. Okay buy for me.
Nice top with reasonable price.  A little bit difference from the picture, but still OK to me. Fast shipment. Quality is good for the price.  Thanks :)
thanks for the product.......... fit nice.......... i love it!!!! <3.....I'll recommended... what else can i said about it, you will love it too!

I'm 5'5" 130 and ordered a M, normally I would purchase a small, but the fit is great. I love this shirt because it is so different than what you can find at a department store. The color is as described, only 4 stars though... the sleeves are a bit short. I will have to push them up.
Very good, nice color like it was on a picture, size is perfect, came on time. I'm so satisfied with this product.

With my skin tone the nude color washes me out. However this shirt worked for me because of the slight shimmer in the lace that reflects lighting. I wear a medium and ordered the medium and it fits perfect. Fabric is thin but is what I expected for this price. The quality of shirt looks good. When you look at the shirt unworn it looks like a plain lace shirt but when you wear it, the details of the shirt hits you in all thr rigt places therefore it no longer looks like a plain lace shirt. I am really happy about this purchase.
The top is quite nice for the price and fits well.  I didn't give it five stars as the quality is not the best...but hey, the price is pretty good
Omg I love this top so much it is perfect. I got it in a large and I love it very much

I just received this shirt in the mail yesterday.  It's true to size, which doesn't always happen when you buy online.  It looks just like the picture.  I'm looking forward to wearing it out.  My only complaint is that I wish the sleeves were a bit longer.  I'm 5'10", so this happens often anyway.  Other than that, it's really cute and fits nice.

I ordered the biege. The shirt I received was same color as the picture, but not entirely the same design. In the picture, it is a lace covered collar, but in mine, it is just lace. In the picture, the barrel cuff looks long (like 3-4 inches) and is probably same cloth as the shirt, but in mine, the cuff is only 2 inches and made of lace. When worn, I feel that I look a little outdated. Had they not changed the cuff and the collar to lace, it might have made me feel a little young-ish :-) It is still a very nice shirt though. True to size. The lace and cloth are very soft. Workmanship is very good.

I really LOVE this blouse! It's made very well, the material is soft and stretchy, and it looks great. I wish i would've purchased a sise small though because it doesn't fit as snug as i would like (I got a medium since I wasn't sure if it ran small or not) but I will wear it until I order another one in a size small. I will also be purchasing the black one.

I love Allegra K, although it can be hit or miss, and recommed it to everyone, I got a ton of compliments.  Arrived on time.  Professional enough to wear with slacks, casual enough to wear with jeans.  It's a cool for a  long sleeve shirt.  I have tattoos but am a professional so I hide them.  You cannot see my tattoos through this shirt (which is great in the summer).
I got a lot of compliments on this shirt from friends. It is very comfy and soft. I just love it!

Allegra K products can be hit or miss, but I think this one is a hit!
summary: Allegra K products: Hit or Miss. This is a Hit!

reviewText: This dress was somewhat small on me. I do have broad shoulders I guess? The upper lace part of the dress is very pretty but very thin & cheaply made. Otherwise, the dress is quite cute. Just worried that if I wear it once, it's gunna rip.

After buying several other products from this seller in Large I was expecting this to fit like them (tight, form fitting, etc). It was way too big! Two or 3 of me could wear this at one time (I ordered a Large). If you do order this, order it a size smaller that what you normally wear.

I really like this dress, but I'm going to have to have it taken in. I was actually worried about the opposite!

I got the Large, and I'm 5'3'' 155lbs and I carry my weight around my middle. It's a bit big! The material is really neat though, almost silky but stretchy at the same time. The mesh at the top doesn't feel cheap either, but obviously needs to be taken care of to maintain.

Definitely recommend, but be stingy about the size!
the fit of the dress was too small for daughter we ordered size larger than normal and it was small but it fit younger daughter a little bit too big but she will grow in to it

The product that I received is not what is pictured. The picture is of a stick pin brooch but I received a butterfly clasp pin. The pin is so heavy that the backing could not properly hold it and the pin would rotate downwards. I am very dissatisfied with this product.
THIS BROOCH IS MUCH PRETTIER, HEAVIER AND DETAILS SEEM TO BE BETTER. THOUGH THE BRONZE ONE IS A GOOD BROOCH, THIS ONE REALLY MAKES A GREAT ADDITION TO A COLLECTION.
This pin is awesome!!! I absolutely love it! Well polished and shines bright! Looks awesome on my uniform with my other pieces of flare. Tons of compliments.
My daughter absolutely loves this pen. Shiny gold (I could not tell how the others for sale would look-bronze, silver, gold???). Nice shape and good detail.
I love the brooch pin. I have in on my winter coat and I wear it everywhere. Everyone compliments me on it.
Awesome pin, great detail, like in the movie. My 13 year old loves this pin. Wears it all the time.

We ordered this particular Hunger Games Mocking Jay pin  because in the picture it clearly appeared to have a pin running alongside the full back of it with an attached clasp.  When the pin arrived, though, it did not have this.  Instead, it had only a short stump that goes through clothing with a detached clasp.  We wrote to the seller asking for this to be rectified and did not hear back.  We are very frustrated at this point.
summary: Not what it appeared to be

reviewText: I love this pin.  I have it on my lunch bag for work and frequently get comments.  It unites us nerds.

I was very disappointed to find that this was a "lapel pin" and not a "brooch". This really should have been better described in the product summary. The artifact in the book and movie was a brooch. Why would you sell a lapel pin to begin with?

I am a HUGE Hunger Games fan. I collect the mockingjay pins. I really wanted the scholastic one. I thought I found it. I didn't.  I was super excited for it to come. I opened the package and it was the same pin as the "Bronze" Hunger Games pin but It was bright shiny gold. It came on the NECA mockingjay pin bord.  It isn't the safetypin style backing. Its the weird twist backing one. The pin itself is pretty but not the one I was sposed get. I will not buy from the seller"Imperial Graphics" again. I'm just probably going to buy all 3 Hunger Games books from scholastic and get the CORRECT pin.
summary: this is NOT the scholastic pin

reviewText: Looks prettier than the picture! About 1 1/2 inch by 1 1/2 inch... Good size! Looks sturdy! Not too shiny either.

I purchased two different MockingJay Pins...this one and a different one.
This one is far more bright and shiny than the other.
This looks "gold" where the other looks "bronze".
My daughter has used both for different purposes.
She used this brighter one for a stage scene since it shone more from the stage.
The other she used for a film scene where the camera caught more definition (and the "gold" would be too much for poor District 12).
So it all depends on what look you're going for.

This shiny gold pin is wonderful. As a huge Hunger Games fan, I love it. But it's a little bit different from the pictures. The arrow is more punctured out. I expected Brooch but I got a butterfly clasp pin. I don't mind it really, but if you're looking for a brooch, WITHOUT butterfly clasp, buy something else. But it's shiny gold, and the wing is really delicate and awesome in every detail. I was worried it would leave fingerprints when I touch it but there's none of it. The diameter is about one and a half inches. It's a bit heavy though. you should consider that. But I love this pin a lot. As a Hunger games fan, I'm very happy to finally have a Mockingjay pin.

My 9-year-old daughter ordered this pin and is over the moon happy with it.  The only problem is that it is relatively heavy and is on a straight pin, so it flips upside down.  If it was on a bar-type backing, it'd be perfect.
summary: Great Pin with one tiny design flaw

reviewText: The pin is high quality and very much what I expect,however it is not the same as the picture describes. The arrow in the mocking jays mouth in the picture goes down, as it does in the movie and book. The arrow in the mocking jays mouth that I received goes up. These were gifts for my students who excelled in a "Hunger Games" game played in my PE classes. My male winners didn't notice the difference, but my female participants did. I had to apologize for the problem and show them what I had ordered and what I received. They were happy they won the prize, but saddened that it wasn't like Katniss'.

Great thing awesome but the back pin support wasn't as great. Fell off somewhere so basically it's a ripoff. The pin in the back doesn't push all the way down so it makes it easy to slip off. Another thing is that it is so heavy the top part like falls down. It really sucks. Now I have a pin that doesn't work and its lost somewhere!

I bought these because they looked adorable on the model in the picture.
I am 5'1" and weigh a little under 150lbs. I am normally a large and once in a while I wear mediums (pants). When I got these, I tried them on, and the black part on the bottom felt like tight tube sock material. Because of that, I had some trouble pulling them up enough so that these pants wouldn't slide off as I bent down to sit. This is strange, since I'm really short! The fabric of the actual pants is soft and comfortable except for the part around the waist which, as shown in the photo, is about 1.5-2 inches wide. It feels kind of restricting. This would probably be fine on someone thinner, like the model is, though! I like the pants, but they look much better on the model than they look on me! That's always the case, isn't it? :P
great style not an item in there line that I don't love. however if you are larger than a size 10 they won't fit. highly recommend if you like different.

It's pretty bearable though, once you get use to it! Overall, I would recommend these pants to anyone who is looking for something comfortable/stylish! : )
So, so comfortable and beautifully stylish and simple! Flattering, too! Second pair of pants I purchased from ELLAZHU. I look forward to more from this merchant.

I remember the MC Hammer pants of 20+ yrs ago, and these, thankfully, are not those.  The crotch is NOT around your knees, but is where any normal pair of pants would be. Abstract print is attractive.

It's true - these are my new favorite pair of pants. This is the first thing I've ever bought from ELLAZHU and I'm impressed with their fashion-forward designs at such low prices. These are comfy and fly. Best worn with boots. Will fit up to a 2x

But beyond the actual size we get, the arms and legs work well on her chunky limbs and the breathable cotton material (a little thinner than the children's place PJs) work well under a sleepsack.

The sleeper is a nice soft cotton. It is a slim fit which the manufacturers are saying is best. The smaller infant sizes increase by only 3 months at a time (3 to 6, or 9 to 12 months), so the jump from 12 months to 18 months is very substantial. It shrinks just a little bit when you wash it, as expected for soft cotton, but the color didn't fade. It is really nice and I'd buy it again.

The Footed Sleeper is great.  It has soft, comfortable cotton, is easy to put on, has a quick, reliable zipper, and a protective tab at the top.  The bottom of the feet are skid resistant, which is wonderful for my early walking grandson.  I always buy Leveret pjs; they wash well, last a long time, and have fun designs.
Daughter loves these.  Points to little birdies on jammies and laughs when we "tweet".  18-24-month size still big on her at 18 months, but works.

Sleeper was absolutely as advertised but didn't come in the estimated time.  Usually my products come several days before and this came several days after.  Not a big deal this particular time, but there have been occasions I really relied on the estimate for planning purposes.

We bought these footed cotton PJs in size 18-24 months, for our 21-month old daughter to wear this summer b/c she won't keep on a blanket and we didn't want her to get chilled when the AC was running. The cotton is super soft and the birdy print is very cute. We also bought her the Bee Striped Footed Sleeper which is just as soft and cute. The fabric is stretchy and there's plenty of room for her to grow, so I expect she'll wear these through the fall. We really like the Leveret brand footed PJs, as we had bought them for our son when he was younger. Nice product with no toxic, flameproof chemicals!
Good quality and fast delivery! Will definitely order again!

We have purchased multiple Leveret footed pajamas. They are great COTTON pajamas. Cotton pajamas allows for a little  stretch so you can actually get your little one in the pajama without feeling like you are going to break them! They do fit about a size smaller than labeled. So in my opinion you should buy a size up.

the product is fine I just have a very chunky 4 month old grandson.  He is off the charts in height and 98% weight.  The length of these Leveret footed pajamas was fine but we could not zip them on him.  The material is good quality - very soft.
summary: the product is fine I just have a very chunky 4 month old ...

reviewText: It's a very cute little footed sleeper, but its a little long on my one year old. It makes since, cause the sizing is for 12-18. It will be perfect after he grows some.
Purchased this for my niece.  It is super cute & soft.  Can't wait to see her in it!
Just right!!!
Wow, I'm surprisingly impressed! Soft, comfy, a little stretchy, and super cute. Also, didn't shink even after wash.

I really like this for my son:  we use it as cotton long underwear under his winter clothes.  Wearing this, his ankles and feet are covered and I don't have to worry about him pulling his socks off or having bare cold ankles on a cold winter day.

We bought this sleepsuit because this was the only one that was cotton and had footsies. The sleepsuit fit so well and all the three designs had the same sizing which is very rare in other baby clothing. My child had just started walking and would always slip with the other sleep suits but this fit so well and snug that he loved it.
summary: My child had just started walking and would always slip with the other sleep suits but this fit so well and snug that he loved i

reviewText: Very comfortable, snug pajama sleeper. It is quite soft. Nice colors and overall design. The legs are slightly too long, but still very nice pajamas.
these are adorable  and soft (nice quality) no chemical smells..but huge on my 18 month old we will have to wait awhile to she fits in them.
summary: these are adorable and soft (nice quality) no chemical smells

reviewText: These are the most adorable pajamas! I bought them for my 19mo son and they fit perfectly. He is in 75% percentile and they are just right with room to grow. The material is thick knit and I like the material much more than Carters. The print on these is just precious on my son.  Leveret is my favorite new brand!

I love these, and they are such a great value and so much better made than other brands in this price range. But, the 18-24 month runs bigger than the 12-18 month; my daughter has almost grown out of the 12-18 but the 18-24 is still way too big. Looking forward to when they fit!
Very useful.
Darling! Love the zipper pjs.
They run large, so I would suggest buying a size smaller. But the quality is excellent. I will definitely  buy again.
summary: But the quality is excellent. I will definitely buy again

reviewText: Our 12 month old is a big guy so this 18-24 month size is great! Nice pjs for spring!
summary: ... a big guy so this 18-24 month size is great! Nice pjs for spring

reviewText:
()  ::A:: ::W:: ::E:: ::S:: ::O:: ::M:: ::E::
So cute on my grand daughter...
I love Leveret footed pajamas.  They fit very well (although my child is small, so some may think they are too tight, I think they are perfect) and the designs are adorable.

It's bigger than I anticipated for our 16 month old (she's in the meaty part of the bell curve for height and weight), but she can grow into it.  I love the separates, which fit perfectly and are the same size as the footed jams.

i loved this on my daughter!!!! it was great for spring/summer nights, very lights and breathable but still warm and cozy. i guessed a size up bc my daughter has chunky legs so my daughter was 9m at the time, i got a 12m and it fit her legs really well.

100% cotton and soft. Fits as expected. Our baby loves it! The pattern is cute and unisex. The price is great compared to other 100% cotton sleepers we've found, and it's one of the few one piece cotton sleepers we've been able to find (with feet in them) in our son's 12-18 month size. I'm very glad we purchased these! They've held up great to multiple washings and still look brand new after lots of near daily use! Will definitely buy again!
Nice pj's for my 11 month old.  Legs are a bit too long but since the size is 12-18 so his feet come out of the footies when crawling around, but that's not a knock on the product.
summary: Nice pj's for my 11 month old

reviewText: Nice to find good cotton pajamas at a reasonable price. these have some stretch to them, are breathable & adorable! too many baby clothes are fleece or cheap polyester.
runs big! very good quality. i will keep till baby grows into it, as its all season

This is the 3rd time I'm buying Leveret pajamas, they work pretty well for me. My baby is in the lower weight percentile, but right in the middle of her age scale for height, and I got her a 12 months size, even though she's 10 months old. I compare these pajamas to Carter's, and Carter's pajamas' feet and legs somehow were always too small, so the baby could barely  stretch her legs in them, and had to curl her toes. Not so with Leveret: there's room to grow in these. I like the non-slip feet also, they help on laminated floor. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that I think the fit is on the smaller side, since my 10M old is wearing a 12M size. I would recommend these pajamas.
Good pjs. Soft, true to size and cute!
Does the job. Keeps baby warm.
We love these pajamas.  Cute and cozy.  Cotton and stretchy.  Everything baby pajamas should be.
Excellent!

I like these pajamas but they don't stay on at all on the heel, my baby is always dragging them around and they don't stay on when she sleeps either. The carter pajamas stay on wayyy better, they have a tighter elastic band, and they also have a better grip on the bottom of the foot for when the baby walks. They are comfortable and the same length as the carters, I plan on sewing a tighter elastic band on the heel to make them work but I won't be buying any more of these.
summary: cute, comfortable, but they don't stay on

reviewText: LOVE these pajamas!!

I keep buying these in bigger sizes as my daughter grows. I have multiple pairs of Leveret cotton pajamas (two-piece and one-piece footies) and they are the BEST on the market. These have a zipper, which allows for easier and faster diaper changes during the night. They stretch without being shapeless, which gives us a lot of wear before needing a bigger size. If your child is tall, these give room without being bulky or squishing your child's feet. They are also super-soft, wash well and are a great value for the price. I have tried lots of pajama brands and they don't compare.
Comfy jammies.  I bought size 18-24 for my 9 month old, for him to grow in to.  So that size is a few inches to long, but I just bunch up the feet and put on some socks, and everything else fits!
WE LOVE IT; SHE WEARS THEM NOW, BUT WILL HAVE THEM LONGER BECAUSE SHE'LL GROW INTO THEM :)

These are a very, very slim fit pajama. They work for us because our daughter is long and lean and they are still a tight fit. Good mid weight material.  Can be worn from Spring until fall in our Chicago area weather.

Only 4 stars because of alot of strings that I have to constants cut off and the zipper sticks sometimes.
These are the only jammie's I buy. They are relatively inexpensive, warm but light weight, and cute designs. You will only get one child's use out of them though. Not hand-me-down quality.
Loved these for the price.
Loved the sleeper, but it streches alot when my baby sleeps causing her to trip over the feet when she wakes up and starts to play.
Great product and fit just as planned. Lightweight fabric that is soft and comfortable.
Cute, a little long which I wanted. My baby is 28 inches, 6 mo the old, 19 lbs. Would deff order more.
summary: good fit for our tall girl!

reviewText: It's a gift for someone else, so can't review yet
Perfect fit and I love the 100% cotton fabric and the zipper closure.
He is A VERY big boy for his age and the softness of fabric and stretch is just enough to be comfy
Great fit, adorable designs, soft material
summary: Love Leveret PJS - adorable and cozy

reviewText: Super cute and soft.
Baby likes it.
best PJ's - just order a size up if your child's size is true to their age.
My grandaughter  is a pretty big baby but these fit her perfectly  and with the easy close zipper and good in the laundry they are functional too.
These pajamas were super cute but they shrunk like crazy and kind of oddly- like the body shrunk alot of not the length. So we only got a few wears out of it.

I bought 3 of these sleepers for my grandson and my daughter just told me that in just a couple of weeks the zippers have started opening from the bottom during the night.  When she gets him out of his crib in the morning one of his feet is usually hanging out but the top of the zipper is still closed.  Very disappointed in the quality of the zippers.

My daughter is very tall for her age.  17 Months and 33.5 inches tall and about 28-30 lbs.  Tall and skinny.  I really like that these PJs are actually a just a little bit big on her, and she can grow into them throughout the summer. We got size 18-24 Months. I ordered 3 set of sleepers and love all 3!  I like the light-weight material and cute prints.  The material is a bit stretchy so it moves well with her active life.  I will order more of these as we need them!

I will recommend this to anyone looking for 100% cotton, well fitted bed time clothes for a toddler. My kid loves the birds on it, and this conversation makes sure she doesn't create too much trouble while changing at bed time.

I am very disappointed with the brand, Leveret.  Not knowing the quality of the brand, I ordered three pair of Leveret pajamas.  On one pair, the zipper pulled apart the very first wear.  I tried fixing it, but by the third wash and wear it was un-reparable and I had to throw them away. The zippers are cheaply made on all three pairs, so I don't think it was a fluke in the one pair.  (As for the other two pair---I ordered a size up, so the second one hasn't been warn.  The third pair, she still wears, but I am VERY careful of the zipper b/c of the quality issue.) Super cute designs. Cheaply made.  I would NOT recommend this brand if you are looking for a quality pajama.)
summary: Not a quality pajama.  Save your money.

reviewText:
I'm so happy I finally found a pajama that is comfortable on my 14 month old. Up to 9 months all the pj's available are nice and loose and comfortable for infants. As soon as they transition to size 12 months the pj's are all super snug. I have bought pj's from every major brand trying to find an appropriate one and I was always disappointed at how tight they were. I know it has something to do with being flame retardant but if your baby is that close to flames I think you've got bigger problems. This pj fits perfectly. I guess it still qualifies as "snug" but the arms and legs are wider than the norm and I was thrilled the first time I put my baby in one. The feet are also the perfect size as some of the other ones had tiny feet. I love that he is comfortable during his naps and I'm not squeezing his hands through tiny cuffs. In the past I have actually cut the cuffs off pajamas because they were leaving marks on him and going up a size made the pj way too long. And he is not an enormous baby. So glad I found this one. I have ordered 4 more.
UPDATE: less than 2 months later and the zipper has completely come apart on 2 of the pj's....still love the one that's hanging in there but I would have loved for the zipper to be stronger. Never had this problem with any other pj.

So far, seems like pretty good quality for the price. The cotton is pretty thin, though, so unless you keep the room toasty at night or cosleep with your child, these are better for spring/fall/colder summer nights. You can, for example, see baby's skin through the bottom of the feet, in the white pjs at least. The grippies on the feet are not very thick, so I'm not sure how long they will last if you let baby run around for a while before bedtime. Otherwise, the bird design is so cute (and our little one seems to like them too!).
It's okay. Too thin for my liking. In fact, I could see my sons diaper through the crotch area. Seems like the zipper will not last as it gets stuck on the fabric often.
second time i have ordered these jammies in next size up.  so precious for boy or girl and fit great.  love the light color and little birdies!

Wanted to get this type of of sleep wear for my son. It came in the mail and I was not impressed.
Fabric - too thin
Elastic - around the ankle was weak.

Finally found some carters brand and for 3 to 4 dollars less. Better quality overall.
These came with the bumble bees ones as there were no more footed ones that fit.  Arrived on time and we will see how they wash and wear now that the weather is turning cool.  They fit well.
It is so cute!

I ordered one size big for my son after reading all the reviews but it was a little bit too long for him. I think at least at 7 months of age, the 6-12 would have been a better choice. It is still holds well around the torso, but I imagine that might stretch out for a bigger baby. They do say that it is supposed to be snug. I am going to try a smaller size next because I like the material and the designs and the bigger one will be useful when he grows up a little anyway.

I ordered these a few sizes larger for my very tall 6 month old.  They were cute and seemed fine at first, but after only about 3-4 times wearing them, the zipper completely split open from head to toe AND the same thing happened to a second pair after the same number of uses.  They were still very much on the large size for her, so it definitely wasn't because we were trying to stuff our baby into a too-small pair of pjs.  Overall, they just felt and turned out to be a more cheaply-made and flimsy product than I was expecting.
This is a great sleeper.  A little long but it will fit her for a while.  Very soft cotton and adorable print.

This is a cute pajama outfit, but it is longer and leaner than my baby. I got it because he is growing out of the 9 month size and will need 12-18 month size. But he is only 7 months (though 20 pounds) and still round. So his belly seems bulbous in these, they barely fit his torso, and the legs are quite long. The stretchy fabric is helpful, but I will hold on to these and see if they work when he gets a little taller and presumably slimmer in proportion. Right now I keep it in my diaper bag as a backup in case I'm out and his outfit gets soiled.

The kid needed new pajamas, and I just couldn't resist this one.  We have one other Leveret footed pajama item (the turtle print one), which we like and is adorable but isn't the softest of pajamas.  This one hit it out of the park.  Super-cute, fits our little newly-toddler well, and is soft and supple.  And it's the perfect weight of cotton to work in pretty much all seasons (in winter with a cozy sleep sack, and in summer just on its own).  Oh, and the feet stay on the kid's feet, even if he decides to get down and crawl around some, which i think is pretty important.

I purchased another pair of these in the 6-12 month size (the pale pink & brown striped ones) to try out before getting a bunch of them. They fit nicely with just a little room to grow, so I ordered two more pairs in different designs (birds and whales). Both of these fit too tightly, and my daughter will not be able to wear them for very long. I like the design of the pajamas, and the prints are cute, but I'm pretty disappointed with the inconsistent sizing.
Fits okay, but zipper not so easy to zip up. Don't know if it is because of where the zipper is placed on the sleeper or not.
summary: Leveret Footed Birds Design Pajama Sleeper 100% cotton

reviewText: These PJs are great!  My 8 month old is 22 lbs. (almost 23) and these fit her almost perfect. The legs are little long, so there is extra material at her feet, but otherwise, these fit great.  I've had a hard time finding PJs that fit her and these are almost perfect.

We like this brand and this design is cute (although it is pretty feminine and probably better for a girl than a boy), but after only a few wears, the zipper broke. The fit is so snug, even when it is a little long on our son, that it strains the zipper and it started splitting. Our son is very small and thin for his age, so it has nothing to do with his zsize. If your child is chubby in the least, this would probably not work well for you.
summary: Snug Fit, Cute, But Broken Zipper

reviewText: For the price you can't go wrong. They are thin, but wear and wash very well. Nice for summer nights when it's a little cool out but fleece pjs would be too hot.

I ordered the 12-18 month size for my 11 month old, 22 lb daughter because I wanted the pajamas to fit her for a while. Instead, I barely even zip them up (same goes for the other footie PJs that have birds but are fleecy, except I actually physically could not zip them without zipping her thigh - she doesn't have chubby thighs either!). She didn't get to wear them a single time. I bought them right before leaving on an international trip. Leveret sent an email just after the order was delivered asking me to "give them a chance to address any problems prior to leaving feedback". I have responded to that email twice about the too-small PJs but they have not replied. I just got back from our trip and was trying to figure out how to return the items, but the return window is 30 days so I've missed it by 3 days. That's not Leveret's fault but all the other baby items I purchased in that order have a 1 year return window, so it is disappointing.
summary: Very small PJs for age marking

reviewText: Cozy, cute comfy, we all love it. Good fit, feet not slippery, Zipper works great, need to buy a bigger size soon.
Fit well as sized and nice and soft. Fabric holding up well and very cute design. Would order label again

I love these jammies. The design is so cute. It is hard to find cute footie PJs for girls that aren't way too girly or fleece(or crazy expensive!). These have a very pretty bird design and they are a nice, thin cotton- perfect for my hot-natured babe.
I love the soft padding on the bottom of the foot. It doesn't feel like sandpaper when little feet kick you in the face :)

The fit is very similar to Carter's brand snug pajamas. Sizing chart is very off for my baby, I'm not sure why. My girl is 9 months, only 19lbs, tall and slim, and is currently wearing 18month footie PJs(the size I ordered). I think all baby clothing sizing is way off, but I was expecting it to fit exactly as it does(perfect!) from experience.
summary: Fit is same as Carter's "snug fit" footie PJ's

reviewText: I've bought a few of these sleepers for my kid, and although they're really cute, I haven't been impressed with their durability. The snap on one has started to come off after not many wearings, and the zipper on another has broken. I don't expect kids' clothes to last forever, but these are not the cheapest sleepers on the market, and for the price, I would have hoped that my son would outgrow them before they started to fall apart.

I like the look of this sleeper quite a bit. It's more simple than most, which I see as an attribute. My only complaint is that the material is not particularly soft. It's better than some but nowhere near as nice as brands like Hanna Andersson.
This is a great lightweight sleeper for my little one who tends to run on the warm side at nighttime.  Great quality, has held up well through many washings! Great price also!
While the print is cute, this fabric is really thin. The Carter's cotton PJs we have are a much sturdier fabric, and cost a lot less.

These PJ's are super adorable, well made and very soft.  They run on the long and thin side of things which is great for our tall and lean son.  I would recommend these PJ's and will be shopping for this brand again in the future.

This has been an on-going problem with finding PJs for DD...the zipper is always straining to close around the thigh/butt area.  (Not that Mama would know ANYTHING about that.)  These zip comfortably without being crazy long or baggy everywhere else.  Pattern is cute, fabric is okay.  A little thin for the price, but oh well.
summary: PJs With Room for Junk in Baby Trunk

reviewText: Really cute birds, fits my 9 month old well (she's big). Because it's white, the stains do show more and it gets kind of grungy around the wrists but that's what babies do!

I purchased this for my son who is 12 months old and weighs 22lbs. The 12-18 month size fits him well. The material is a lightweight cotton and is comfortable. The zipper makes dressing and changing diapers easier. Very glad we found this as we were unable to find  any 12 month footies that weren't polyester or flannel. This material is nice for the summer months.
Very cute, comfortable pajamas.  Cotton feels a little rough, but I think that is due to the fire retardant.  My baby seems to like the PJs, and she gets compliment on them.

Zipper separated and no longer functions.  The Pajama Sleeper was a complete waste of money, zipper seems to be very cheaply made.  Otherwise the outfit was soft and the material was thin (great for summer). Sizes run a little small.
This product fits my little guy very well. I think the print is suitable for a boy or girl. I would buy this product again.
They are adorable!  I Should have gone up one size so my grandson could grow into them. They fit perfectly now.
This brand runs small, but the problem was that the zipper broke after about 3 washes. Don't know why, as I've ordered others of this brand and they've been fine.
summary: Zipper broke after only a couple washes

reviewText: Baby just a year old and this fits perfectly. She is 30% percentile for height and weight. I expect this to work for several more months. Nice to know this isn't coated in flame retardant as it is supposed to fit more snuggly because of that. Also, zipper is much nice than snaps. Though, wish it would come in organic cotten.

This product is even cuter in person than in the pictures, and is true to size.  My daughter loves it as pajamas in the summertime.  It covers her up but is still very breathable fabric.  Great product!
It washes up very nice, purchased a size larger based on reviews and it was a perfect fit for my twins
summary: Very nice and light for summer wear

reviewText: Just bought this for our daughter in 5T (she's tall for her age).  The birdies are very cute, and the cotton is quite soft.  It also washes well.

Fits 5 yr old daughter like a glove, even after 50+ hot wash/hot dry cycles. Nice touch with the zipper flap to avoid catching skin. I purchased another because it's exactly what I was looking for. Lightweight, all cotton, sturdy, adorable prints, survives hot wash/dry cycle.
I wish they would produce size 6,7 and 8 footed pjs!

I bought a size 5 T for my 37lb 3.5 yr old.  The sizing chart suggested my son is a 4T, but I wanted these PJs to fit for a while so I got 5t which already fits snug.  Other than that the quality is exactly what we were looking for.

I was looking for light summer pajamas for my daughter that would keep her from taking her diaper off, and these fit the bill. I bought 6 pairs in different colors/patterns.  They are soft cotton and seem comfortable.  They are true to size and did not shrink much in the laundry.  The material is thin and stretches out, however.  I've had one of the zippers break already, after just a few uses.
summary: Good for summer but a little flimsy

reviewText: My first reaction to these footed pajamas was very positive.  Cute, my daughter loved them, they were light weight which meant she could wear them in the summer, and footed pajamas are all she will wear.  HOWEVER, these are even lower quality than Carters.  She has two pair of light weight footed PJs- these and Carters.  The carters 4T fits still although the arms are snug but stretch ok.  The Leveret I actually bought in 5T and she stretches in the thigh, the crotch rides very low but the stickler- her toes have popped through both feet.  The feet are crazy small and she has holes in the tips where her big toe AND the next toe come through.  I liked the light weight feature for the summer but the cut is horrible.
This print is so darling! Incredibly soft cotton that washes beautifully. No problems with the zipper so far- will definitely buy this brand again!
colorful bird design is very darling!!  My daughter is 40 pounds and this fit her with some room to go.
Our 2.25 y.o. daughter strongly prefers wearing footed PJs, but most are too thick for warm summer nights.  These, however, are just right!
summary: Great lightweight PJs for warm nights

reviewText: This is the 4th or 5th pair of Leveret pajamas I have purchased for my daughter. I love them all. Really comfortable, soft, great fit. Room to grow. Just really nice qualify pajamas. Thanks!
my toddler is doing great in this sleeper.  the non-slip grippers on the feet are really effective.  I've never purchased this brand before but definitely would again.  true to size.
summary: great sleeper, especially for the price

reviewText: My 21month old little girl loves these PJs!! The birds are cute! the material soft and thin. and it turning into summer and her having eczema, it was very important to me to find her some 100% cotton footed pajamas so she does not scratch in the middle of the night! We purchased the size 3T and they are a little longer than i expected. but she has the whole summer to grow into them! LOVE THEM!
My 18 month old grandson looks so adorable in this pajama! The lively colored birds will help him learn colors and keep him cozy while learning!
Our granddaughter loves her new "birdie jammies".  Nice, soft, 100% cotton, lighter weight for summer.  I highly recommend these footie pajamas.

These fit well, are 100% cotton, hold up well after repeated washings (no noticeable shrinkage and the colors aren't fading more than you would expect with any clothes you wash repeatedly. Some from this brand have a top-snap at the neck to cover the zipper pull, others don't, so if that matters to you check the pictures on the style/design you're looking at before you buy a particular style.

Very thin material and they shrank almost a full size on the first wash.  The print is adorable though, so if you want a very light pajama with feet, order up a size.  If you're looking for something that will last or will offer anything more than a thin layer of protection, skip it.
I purchased 3t, for a little girl who is in 3t/4t clothes. fits perfectly with stretchiness left over sand she still has room to grow. she loves the birds. says they are birdies from Rio. love it.
These foooted pajamas are the coziest!  Love the quality too.  My son loves them and they are just the cutest on.

I was looking for footed pajamas for my 6 month old that have a zipper and these fit the bill. For some reason he doesn't love diaper/pajama time, so he gets fussy and wiggly as we try to get him ready for bed. For that reason, the zipper is much easier than lots of snaps that most pajamas have these days. These pajamas are pretty lightweight, which is fine because he also wears a sleep sack to bed to keep him cozy. Also the print is cute. I do prefer the striped leveret jammies (which I also bought) because they seem a bit softer than the bird fabric, but that's Ok. My little guy is currently about 15 lbs, about 27 inches and he fits into these jammies pretty well, though he has plenty of room to grow.

These pajamas are a nice cotton alternative to fleece pajamas for warmer nights.  The design is cute without being girly.  The bottoms of the feet have grippers, so a baby who is working on standing up and walking hopefully would be able to wear these jammies while doing so.  The pajamas seem very well made.  They are pricier than other cotton pajamas that my daughter also wears (usually Gerber (but check out Carter's for awesome fleece pajamas)), but they do seem to be better quality (which is not to say that we've had any issue with the Gerber pajamas).
This adorable pajama sleeper is just perfect for my 6 month-old, 17 pound granddaughter. The fabric is soft and the sleeper washes beautifully. An instant winner!
own many of these. our child loves them
They fit a pretty chunky 6 month old, but are starting to get a little tight at 7 months. Love the material. Great quality product!
summary: They fit a pretty chunky 6 month old

reviewText: This jammy is on the larger side of sizing.  However, excellent quality and make!  We love it!

I really like this pajamas, and it s a very good quality product. It fits well, and looks great on my son. To me the only thing that could be improved is the zipper. It would be so much easier to reverse the zipper so when you change your baby (at night for example) you don t have to completely open the zipper to change the diaper. If the zipper was starting at the leg and was going up (instead of starting on the chest to go down), you would only have to unzip he legs to change the diaper and not the full body. Don t know if it makes sense but right now I have to fully undress him to change his diaper when I would rather unzip just the legs and not the upper body, this make a big difference when your baby sleeps and you want to change him without waking him up. Other than that, the pajamas is great.
summary: Great pajamas but I would definitely reverse the zipper

reviewText: My daughter is 9 months and a normal size baby and everything she wears is 9 month size but these run small especially after you wash and dry them. I'm very disapointed. My daughter will barely be able to wear these for a couple of weeks.
summary: My daughter is 9 months and a normal size baby ...

reviewText: The pattern is so unique!  My baby gets so many compliments when she wears this.
The fit was perfect.  Our grand daughter is small for her age so gave her a little growing room which is just what I was hoping for.  She just turned 1.
summary: The fit was perfect. Our grand daughter is small for her age ...

reviewText: They fit perfectly with room to grow!
Seemed small. But was cute. It's thin material and fits really tight.
The feet are really large in comparison to the rest of the outfit.

Had never heard of the Leveret brand, just needed some zip up footies for my 6 month old (bought the 6-9month) - LOVE these. They are soft and stretchy and extremely adorable on. Very happy with our purchase.
summary: Bought these because of the price - would buy again and again

reviewText: great fit and soft & comfy
Cute but material is thin.
as pictured

Our 8 month old had outgrown the Gerber brand footed zip-up sleep 'n play suits which only go up to 9 months and have tiny feet in them, so I was in need of a similar suit for her to sleep in.  I found the Leveret brand here on Amazon and while they do cost a bit more, they will also last so much longer.  They are ribbed cotton so they stretch for a snug fit (similar to Carter's baby line of clothing, but slightly thicker) and the foot room is ample!  On consecutive spit-up/leak free nights she can wear the same jammies 3 nights in a row without them stretching out.  I would imagine that they can actually be worn for nearly the full 6 months as their size indicates.  My only complaint is the lack of selection on Amazon in the unisex prints.  I prefer not to dress my girl in pink hearts and bows.  The birds are super cute as are the red and pink stripes.  I highly recommend paying a little extra for these.  They are worth it.
summary: Cute jammies with room to grow!

These leggings are awesome!

They go up above your waist, as pictured, so when you sit, they will crease around your belly a little bit. I don't mind that. Because the waist band is wide and hugs gently, it creates a smooth silhouette for your midsection. NO vicious waist band to cut in and give you that weird double fat roll look. I hate that! The waist band is nice and stretchy, so you could eat a big meal and be comfortable.

The high waist also adds warmth, I find. I love that.

The fabric is not cotton, it's nylon - so it's thinner, shinier and clingier than a cotton legging, but it's not as thin as tights. It's in between. Unless you're very bold, you probably wouldn't wear them as "pants". I wear them under skirts. The legs are totally opaque. The length is great on me, I'm 5'7".

One of the things I dislike about wearing a fitted top over tights or leggings is the visible line where the leggings end at your hips or waist.  These solve that entirely -- the high waist is high enough that it goes up past my bra band, and I'm 5'8".  They're slightly shiny so they look more like thick tights than leggings, but they're not sheer like most tights so you don't have to worry about your butt showing.  They're also super comfortable.  I was a little worried since they're one size and I'm tall and wear between 8 and 10 in US sizes; usually things that come in one size are made for women smaller than me.  I figured they'd be too short and I'd just have to wear them with boots, but they come down nicely to the ankle.  It makes me think they might be too long on shorter women, but that's just a guess.

reviewText: I wore lots of tights and leggings before, but most of the times they got broken stitches or holes quickly.  I ordered the Highlighter and the Everyday Slim High Waist ones to hope for a little more waist control after pregnancy and slim fit. Usually, I wear size 6 to 8 (Med to Large).  I found the Everyday Slim one is thicker and more comfortable than the Highlighter, though I do like the shine on the Highlighter.  However, after wearing both... I can see a little "stretch" on the stitiches and tiny holes already. I was hoping for a more long lasting stitches.  After all, I do like them in terms of quality and price; and I hope they will last longer than my other old ones.
